report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.07.0]
TIME: 8 p.m.
This is a consult from Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] for an incurvating, left great toe.
HISTORY: The patient is well known to me. She has been seen occasionally for this problem as a house call as the patient does not do well getting into the office. She was admitted at this visit with cellulitis of the legs and also a dental problem. The patient is alert. She is semi-ambulatory. She has absence of pedal pulses, and all nails are dystrophic. She has an incurvating nail causing pain and what seems to be a resolving infection from the antibiotic therapy. At this time, she has a limitation of motion at the first MPJ and redness in the legs. The skin of the feet is intact. The gross sensation does seem to be diminished. She has a long history of diabetes.
ASSESSMENT: We will debride the nails for the patient's comfort and remove the incurvating fibular portion of the nail to make sure the onychia is resolved. Upon removal, no pus was found underneath the area because of the antibiotic therapy.
PLAN AND TREATMENT: Removal of bending portion of nail and evaluation of onychia, left great toe and debridement of other nails for the patient's comfort. We will, distal on the left great toe, use Betadine b.i.d. for 3 days as to shrink the tissue of the fibular border, left great toe.
______________________________ **NAME[WWW M XXX], D.P.M.
HS Job # 888945 / 41124 / 32008 # **ID-NUM D: **DATE[May 22 2007] 20:17 T: **DATE[May 24 2007] 01:39
